intro: Krascheninnikovia compacta, commonly known as the desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Eurasia. It is a low-growing perennial that forms dense mats of foliage, which helps it survive in harsh, dry environments. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are usually covered in fine hairs, reducing water loss through transpiration. Krascheninnikovia compacta is adapted to sandy soils and can tolerate extreme temperature fluctuations.
